programme.title: Voetbal
programme.desc: De Wedstrijd van je Leven wordt dit jaar gespeeld in het Gelderse Rietmolen. Het eerste elftal van VV Rietmolen speelt op het eigen sportpark tegen een team van ex-profs onder leiding van coach Theo Janssen. Onder meer Andy van der Meijde, Bram van Polen, Tom Beugelsdijk en Stefanie van der Gragt komen in actie en Bas Nijhuis is de scheidsrechter van dienst. Aletha Leidelmeijer presenteert, Hans Kraay jr. doet de interviews en het wedstrijdcommentaar komt van Koert Westerman.

programme.desc: De Wedstrijd van je Leven wordt dit jaar gespeeld in het Gelderse Rietmolen. programme.desc: Heracles Almelo was in 2003 de eerste profclub in Nederland met kunstgras in het stadion. programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Heracles Almelo was in 2003 de eerste profclub in Nederland met kunstgras in het stadion. Na 21 jaar namen de Almeloërs afgelopen zomer als laatste Eredivisieclub afscheid van het kunstgras. Heracles Almelo is nu de eerste club in Nederland met een duurzaam systeem onder het veld waarmee de grasmat van onderaf bewaterd en belucht kan worden.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Defending champion Birmingham (6-3) won three of its last four games after a 26-22 win over Michigan behind J'Mar Simth and Larry Rountree III; Memphis (2-7) defeated the Stallions, 24-20, on April 25 behind 235 passing yards from Dresser Winn.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Tony Stewart leads Shawn Langdon in Top Fuel by three points, Austin Prock leads Jack Beckman in Funny Car by 51 points and Dallas Glenn leads Greg Anderson in Pro Stock by 11 points following Chicago, the sixth event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Vancouver progressed past Inter Miami with a 5-1 aggregate victory in the semi-finals round after a 3-1 win in the second leg on April 30; Cruz Azul claimed a 2-1 aggregate win against Tigres through a 1-0 shutout victory in the second leg on May 1.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou continued his dominant start with his first Indianapolis 500 win of his career to increase his lead over Pato O'Ward to 112 points; Scott Dixon won the race at Detroit last year over Marcus Ericsson.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: St. Louis (7-2) won five-straight games after a 39-13 win over San Antonio behind Max Duggan and Brandon Silvers; DC (6-3) defeated the Battlehawks, 27-15, on April 13 behind 243 passing yards and three touchdowns from Jordan Ta'amu.

programme.title: 2025 CONCACAF Women's U-20 Championship
programme.desc: USA claimed 7-0 victories against Puerto Rico in both of their meetings from 2022's Championship, last led by a hat-trick from Simone Jackson in the semi-finals round; Michelle Copper found the net with a brace in the shutout win.

programme.title: Indycar INXT Qualifications
programme.desc: NXT drivers aim for the best starting position in the upcoming race in Detroit, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded the pole position on the front row of the starting grid; the second-fastest time starts outside the pole sitter.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Qualifications
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers aim for the best starting spot in the upcoming race, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded pole position; Colton Herta averaged 97.808 mph to win the pole at Detroit last year before finishing the race in 19th.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Corey Heim secured his fourth win of the season and second in the last four races with a dominant victory at Charlotte over Ross Chastain; Christian Eckes averaged 101.829 mph in his win at Nashville last year, beating Daniel Dye by 2.028 seconds.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.title: NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: New Zealand (8-0-3) snapped an eight-match losing streak to the Rabbitohs with a 34-4 victory last season, as Shaun Johnson notched two tries and added five conversions; South Sydney (6-0-5), which comes off a bye in Round 12, has won two in a row.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Tigres and Cruz Azul played to a 1-1 draw in the first leg of the semi-final on April 23 where Juan José Purata equalized for Tigres in the 85th minute of play; Carlos Rotondi had broken the 0-0 deadlock in the 69th minute of the draw.

programme.title: 2025 CONCACAF Women's U-20 Championship
programme.desc: USA is coming off of finishing in third place at the 2024 World Cup through a 2-1 victory against the Netherlands after a winner scored in extra-time; Guyana claimed a 1-0 victory against Haiti in a qualification match on Feb. 25.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Vancouver claimed a 2-0 lead over Inter Miami in the first leg of the semi-final on April 24 with goals from Brian White and Sebastian Berhalter; Pedro Vite and Jayden Nelson provided the assists for the Whitecaps in the win at home.

programme.desc: The tournament, which features a $20 million purse, is one of only five events given "invitational" status by the PGA TOUR and includes a reduced field of just 69 golfers; Scottie Scheffler finished with a one-stroke victory in last year's edition.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: World No. 1 Scottie Scheffler took home a $4 million payday after carding a 2-over 74 over the final round to remain atop the leaderboard at 8-under 280 to hold off Collin Morikawa for a one-shot victory in last year's edition of the tournament.

programme.title: PGA Tour Champions Golf
programme.desc: Ernie Els of South Africa carded a 7-under 65 over the final round to remain atop the leaderboard at 21-under 195 to secure a two-stroke wire-to-wire victory over Stephen Ames in last year's edition; Els captured his fourth PGA Tour Champions title.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf
programme.desc: American John Catlin finished at 14-under 274 before defeating Maximilian Kieffer of Germany on the fifth play-off hole to win the tournament the last time it was played in 2021; Golfclub Gut Altentann last hosted the tournament in the 1992 edition.

programme.title: ATP Final: Hamburg
programme.desc: Andrey Rublev appears in his third Hamburg Open final, as the former champion seeks his 351st tour-level victory and a second title here against Italy's Flavio Cobolli. (24.05)

programme.title: WTA Final: Rabat
programme.desc: Maya Joint targets her first WTA Tour singles title as the Australian teenager, who also claimed victory in the Rabat doubles, comes up against unseeded Romanian Jaqueline Cristian. (24.05)

programme.title: ATP Final: Geneva
programme.desc: A chance for Novak Djokovic to join Jimmy Connors and Roger Federer in winning a 100th tour-level title, as the 38-year-old Serb battles Hubert Hurkacz in the Geneva Open final. (24.05)

programme.title: Graf v Seles 1995
programme.desc: Two greats of professional tennis contested the 1995 women's singles final at the US Open, as Monica Seles - returning from a terrifying on-court ordeal in 1993 - faced Steffi Graf.

programme.title: Agassi v Martin 1999
programme.desc: Andre Agassi's 1999 career renaissance concluded with an unforgettable victory at the US Open, earning a fifth Grand Slam title at the expense of his fellow countryman Todd Martin.

programme.title: Sampras v Agassi 2002
programme.desc: In the men's singles final at the 2002 US Open, Pete Sampras would embark on the final match of his illustrious career, extending his perfect record over Andre Agassi at the New York Slam.

programme.title: ATP Final: Doha
programme.desc: In Doha, Great Britain's Jack Draper - entering his fifth ATP final - comes up against fifth seed and 2020 tournament champion Andrey Rublev in the final of the 2025 Qatar Open. (22.02)

programme.title: WTA Final: Doha
programme.desc: Jelena Ostapenko's near seven-year wait to vie for a WTA 1000 title ends in Doha, as the former Grand Slam champion faces 23-year-old American Amanda Anisimova in an unseeded final. (15.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Dubai
programme.desc: A men's singles champion is crowned in the final of the Dubai Duty Free Tennis Championships, an ATP Tour 500 event in the United Arab Emirates. (01.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Dubai
programme.desc: A women's singles champion is crowned in Dubai. Russia's Mirra Andreeva - the youngest-ever WTA finalist - and Denmark's Clara Tauson face off for glory. (22.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper competes in his maiden ATP Masters 1000 final at Indian Wells as the top-10 bound Brit faces Holger Rune. Draper knocked out Carlos Alcaraz in the last four. (16.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Mirra Andreeva meets top seed Aryna Sabalenka in the Indian Wells final. Sabalenka avenged her Australian Open defeat to Keys in the semis, while Andreeva dethroned Swiatek. (16.03)

programme.title: ATP Final: Miami
programme.desc: Chasing a record seventh men's Miami crown, Novak Djokovic - now the oldest ATP Masters 1000 finalist - takes on Jakub Mensik, aiming to win his first tour-level trophy. (30.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Miami
programme.desc: In Miami, the women's final get underway as top seed Aryna Sabalenka meets with home favourite Jessica Pegula in a repeat of last year's US Open decider. (29.03)

programme.desc: Chasing a sixth ATP 1000 title and a first in Monte-Carlo, 21-year-old Spaniard Carlos Alcaraz competes in a blockbuster clash with first-time Masters finalist Lorenzo Musetti. (13.04)
